About Me

A little about me...

BIO

I'm studying for a BS in Computer Science at Southern New Hampshire University and I've attended Hack Reactor. I've previously been a manager at a major chain of grocery stores called H-E-B, and before that I was an artillery operations chief in the Marine Corps. In my spare time I make awesomely fun coding projects.

Hack Reactor

Student

Learned JavaScript, MySQL, data structures, big-o notation, algorithms, and full-stack development. Remote experience.

H-E-B

Overnight Manager

Managed overnight store operations, and inventory for the Drug and General Merchandise departments. Trained and mentored overnight crew, wrote monthly and quarterly performance evaluations, and conducted interviews. Employee of Month/Quarter several times.

United States Marine Corps

Artillery Operations Chief

3.5 years of leadership, teaching experience, and performing administrative duties for 80-120 Marines at a time. Awarded the Navy and Marine Corps Achievement Medal and over a dozen awards and letters of appreciation from high-level officers. Trained and led a team of Marines who manually computed firing trajectories for artillery projectiles in order to accurately fire 100-pound shells over 18km away.
